newsitem.title: UK: Euro oil swaps steady, firmer after Thursday gains.
newsitem.headline: Euro oil swaps steady, firmer after Thursday gains.

text.p: European oil swaps were broadly steady after Thursday's surge although business was noticeably slower after some busy dealing yesterday.
Brent CFDs firmed by a few cents, naphtha rose 50 cents or so, fuel held steady as did gasoline.

Dealers said July 21-25 was pegged around +7 cents against September from +3/4 cents and July 28-August 1 at -3 cents from -7/8 cents. August 4-8 was pegged at -6 cents from -10 cents against September Brent while August 11-15 was flat at -13 cents.
CFD trading was very thin, and nothing was heard done.
Naphtha swaps ticked up slightly with August valued around $191.25 and September at $189.
Gasoline was steady with August around $193.25 and September at $191. Physical eurograde barges sold at $191 fob AR and $193 fob Rotterdam amid tightish prompt supply.
Heavy fuel swaps held at yesterday's levels with physical barges creeping up to close the gap. Wet barrels sold at $89 fob and $90 fob with August swaps valued around $90.
Low sulphur swaps were expected to widen the high-low spread and extend gains past the current $97.25 level for August and $98.25 for September.
